title: PulseGeek
description: Tech news, gaming, and geek culture in one pulse

items.title: Spear Phishing Detection: AI Features That Matter
items.content_text: Discover spear phishing detection features that matter for AI models, with concrete examples, tradeoffs, and practical signals spanning content, sender, headers, URLs, and behavior.

items.title: Implementing AI in Business: A Step-by-Step Playbook
items.content_text: Follow a practical playbook for implementing AI in business. Identify high-value use cases, assess data and risk, integrate solutions, run pilots, measure impact, and scale responsibly.

items.title: Vendor Invoice Matching with ML: Reduce Exceptions Fast
items.content_text: Learn how to implement machine learning for vendor invoice matching in accounting. Plan data, configure models, validate results, and reduce exceptions with controls and auditability.

items.title: Plan AI Projects in Retail Operations: Roadmaps That Work
items.content_text: Learn how to plan AI projects in retail operations with a proven roadmap. Scope problems, ready data, execute pilots, validate results, and scale responsibly.

items.title: The Future of AI in Learning: Adaptive, Fair, and Trusted
items.content_text: Explore the future of AI in learning with adaptive paths, fair assessment, and integrity safeguards, plus clear ties to machine learning concepts and practical rollout steps.

items.title: Mina Crypto: 9 Reasons ZK Natives Are Watching
items.content_text: Explore why ZK builders track Mina crypto. Learn how a tiny chain, recursive proofs, and private zkApps enable verifiable compute, light clients, and practical privacy tradeoffs.

items.title: Sensor Street Lamp: Choosing Motion, Ambient, and Radar
items.content_text: Learn how to choose motion, ambient light, and radar sensors for street lamps, including placement rules, tuning ranges, and control logic tradeoffs for safety and savings.

items.title: Zero-Shot vs Few-Shot Prompting: Accuracy, Control, and Cost Compared
items.content_text: Compare zero-shot vs few-shot prompting by accuracy, control, and cost. See tradeoffs, when to choose each, and practical guidance.

items.title: Zero-Knowledge Proofs: Privacy and Proof Without Sharing
items.content_text: Learn how zero knowledge proofs deliver privacy and compression by proving facts without revealing data, and see where SNARKs, STARKs, and rollups fit. Practical guidance, choices, and pitfalls for builders.

items.title: Why Merkle Proofs Matter: Lightweight Trust at Scale
items.content_text: Learn how Merkle proofs deliver compact verification for blocks and state. See how SPV clients, headers, and Patricia tries enable trust-minimized checks at network scale.

items.title: What Is the Mempool? Where Transactions Wait Their Turn
items.content_text: Learn how the mempool works, why transactions queue, and how fees, priority, and propagation shape confirmation. See how proofs and light clients verify data efficiently.

items.title: What Is the Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Education?
items.content_text: Explore how artificial intelligence changes education across teaching, assessment, and student support. See benefits, risks, ethics, and practical steps for responsible adoption.

items.title: What Is Retrieval Augmented Generation Prompting? Context, Grounding, and Limits
items.content_text: Explore retrieval augmented generation prompting, how it grounds answers with context, where it breaks, and how to operationalize it safely.

items.title: What Is Prompt Leakage and How to Prevent It? Risks, Patterns, and Guardrails
items.content_text: Learn what prompt leakage is, why it’s risky, common patterns to watch, and practical guardrails to prevent it.

items.title: What Is IEC 61850 and Why It Matters for Smart Grids?
items.content_text: Learn what IEC 61850 is, how it enables interoperable substation automation, and why it matters for modern, DER-rich smart grids.

items.title: What Is Continuous Compliance for AI Systems Today?
items.content_text: Learn what continuous compliance for AI systems means, how it works day to day, and how to monitor, evidence, and improve it.

items.title: What Is a System Prompt in AI? Roles, Boundaries, and Best Practices
items.content_text: Learn how system prompts set model behavior, define boundaries, and improve reliability, with practical patterns and safe deployment tips.

items.title: What Is a Reentrancy Attack in Smart Contracts?

items.title: What Is a Microgrid and How Does It Interact with the Utility Grid?
items.content_text: Learn what a microgrid is, how it connects and coordinates with the utility grid, and where it adds value for reliability and resilience.

items.title: What Is a Distributed Ledger? Shared Records at Scale
items.content_text: Learn how distributed ledgers maintain shared records at scale. Explore data structures, consensus, and the role of randomness for lotteries, leader election, and protocol fairness.

items.content_text: Learn what a blockexplorer does, how to read on-chain data, and how explorers support security work like tracing funds, checking contract risks, and verifying transactions.

items.title: What Does Permissionless Really Mean in Web3?

items.content_text: Learn how verifiable random functions bring unbiased, tamper-evident randomness to blockchains, powering fair lotteries, secure leader election, and protocol design without trusted coordinators.

items.content_text: Learn how to track a transaction with a block explorer, read fees and confirmations, and verify integrity using hashes, Merkle roots, and practical proof concepts.
